intro: Rottlera stylaris, commonly known as the slender rottlera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. Rottlera stylaris is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
